articles.author: Reuters
articles.title: India plans refiners' joint oil deals to cut import bill - Economic Times
articles.description: The world's third largest oil importer and consumer, India depends on imports for about 85% of its crude and buys most of it from Middle East producers.
articles.content: India is forming a group that brings together state-run and private refiners to seek better crude import deals, secretary Tarun Kapoor said on Tuesday, as the country grapples with soaring oil prices… [+2105 chars]
